meanings.definition: The state or quality of being cowardly.
meanings.sent1: Her cowardlinesses were evident when she refused to confront the bully.
meanings.sent2: His cowardlinesses made him run away from the scary movie.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cowardlinesses, he managed to muster up the courage to rescue the kitten stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: The dark forest whispered tales of cowardlinesses to those who dared to enter.
meanings.sent5: The cowardlinesses of the villain were so extreme that even the heroes were taken aback.

meanings.definition: The act of showing fear or timidity in the face of danger.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's cowardlinesses were evident as he hesitated to charge into battle.
meanings.sent2: Her cowardlinesses were on full display when she screamed at the sight of a spider.
meanings.sent3: The cat's cowardlinesses were comical as it jumped at the sight of its own shadow.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds seemed to mock the cowardlinesses of the trembling trees.
meanings.sent5: The cowardlinesses of the mouse were no match for the bravery of the lion.

meanings.definition: A lack of courage or bravery.
meanings.sent1: His cowardlinesses prevented him from speaking up for what was right.
meanings.sent2: The team's cowardlinesses led to their defeat in the final match.
meanings.sent3: Despite his cowardlinesses, he managed to stand up to the school bully.
meanings.sent4: The cowardlinesses of the dark clouds delayed the arrival of the much-needed rain.
meanings.sent5: The cowardlinesses of the knight were exposed when he turned away from the dragon's gaze.
